title: Grimtooth
data:
| )   Grimtooth   *(No tile)*           |                                                                                                            |
| ------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Base item                             | [orcish dagger](/wiki/Orcish_dagger "Orcish dagger")                                                       |
|                                       |                                                                                                            |
| Damage vs. small                      | 1d3 **+1d6**                                                                                               |
| Damage vs. large                      | 1d3 **+1d6**                                                                                               |
| To-hit bonus                          | **+1d2**                                                                                                   |
| Bonus versus                          | *(any)*                                                                                                    |
|                                       |                                                                                                            |
| Weapon skill                          | [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")                                                                            |
| Size                                  | one-handed                                                                                                 |
| Affiliation                           | - [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic")
- [orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_attribute\) "Orc (monster attribute)") |
|                                       |                                                                                                            |
| When carried                          | *(none)*                                                                                                   |
| When wielded                          | * detect [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)")                                |
| When [invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") | *(none)*                                                                                                   |
|                                       |                                                                                                            |
| Base price                            | 300 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                                                          |
| Weight                                | [10](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                                                                |
| Material                              | [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron")                                                                                  |

**Grimtooth** is an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic")-aligned, and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is an [orcish dagger](/wiki/Orcish_dagger "Orcish dagger").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Average damage calculation](#Average_damage_calculation)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [4.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.4 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [4.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

Any randomly generated orcish dagger has a base 1⁄20 chance of being made into Grimtooth, as it is the only artifact orcish dagger. Grimtooth may also be given as a [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") to chaotic, non-[elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") characters.

[Player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") [rogues](/wiki/Rogue_\(player_monster\) "Rogue (player monster)") on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") have a 25% chance of [starting with an orcish dagger](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") in place of their initial primary weapon—like all player monsters on the Plane, there is a 50% chance it will be made into an artifact weapon of the same [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Grimtooth is the only artifact orcish dagger, resulting in a 12.5% chance that a Rogue will be carrying it on the Planes.

## Description

Grimtooth has +d2 to hit and a +d6 damage against all monsters, and while wielded it confers [warning against elves](/wiki/Warned_of_monster_type "Warned of monster type"), glowing red when any [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)") are present on the level.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) Characters that are elven, including those [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into elven monsters, cannot wield Grimtooth and will be [blasted](/wiki/Artifact_blast "Artifact blast") if they attempt to.

## Strategy

Grimtooth's weak base item means that even with its damage bonuses to all monsters, it is effectively on par with a normal [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") - most chaotic non-elven players will only consider Grimtooth as an obstacle to receiving [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer") through [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice"). However, it averages the same damage as a [crysknife](/wiki/Crysknife "Crysknife"), without the crysknife's danger of reverting to a [worm tooth](/wiki/Worm_tooth "Worm tooth") or the requirement of a [scroll of enchant weapon](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_weapon "Scroll of enchant weapon") to create.

Despite its relatively low damage in comparison to other artifacts, orcish [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") and Rogues that obtain it early are likely to make good use of it until they acquire Stormbringer, [Fire Brand](/wiki/Fire_Brand "Fire Brand") or [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand").

### Average damage calculation

The average damage calculations in the following table do not include bonuses from [weapon skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill"), [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), or from using a [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") weapon against [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") or [demons](/wiki/M2_DEMON "M2 DEMON").

| Weapon       | Damage                                                                                                |
| ------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| +0 Grimtooth | ![\frac{1+3}{2}+\frac{1+6}{2}=\bold{5.5}](/images/math/f/0/5/f05fa6d9060c2dc58e4dd617975fde8d.png)    |
| +7 Grimtooth | ![\frac{1+3}{2}+\frac{1+6}{2}+7=\bold{12.5}](/images/math/9/b/e/9be4f67d745245fc8f47f0884eebcb4e.png) |

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), Grimtooth gives a flat +6 damage bonus as opposed to 1d6, but is still outshined by the many better artifacts present, particularly for chaotic players. It might be a decent choice for twoweaponing, which is allowed for artifacts in SLASH'EM.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), Grimtooth is permanently [poisoned](/wiki/Poison "Poison") and deals +d6 damage against non-[poison resistant](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") monsters, with a 10% chance of killing them instantly - this makes it markedly more useful. Grimtooth is also the first sacrifice gift for [Rogues](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), Grimtooth has +d5 to-hit, doubled damage, and warning against elves, [humans](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)") and [minions](/wiki/Minion "Minion"). It can be created by naming an orcish dagger, and can be [twoweaponed](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") as a secondary weapon.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), Grimtooth is permanently poisoned as in UnNetHack, though the removal of poison instadeath makes it somewhat less powerful. Its base price is raised from 300 to 1000.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), Grimtooth has a disease-incuding attack with a 1⁄6 chance of inflicting terminal [sickness](/wiki/Sickness "Sickness") on the target. Grimtooth also deals extra damage to elves in addition to bonus damage from [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and has a chance of instakilling any elf it hits (including an elven or drow player).

The sickness inflicted by the disease attack can be used to dispose of targets with massive defenses, such as high level low-AC [player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), that do not have an immunity or a means of curing it. You are credited (or blamed) for monsters that die of terminal illness this way and gain experience as normal.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 270](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L270)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/artilist.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 709](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/artilist.h#L709): *damage bonus against all monsters is special cased in spec\_dbon()*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

)   Grimtooth   (No tile)
Base item orcish dagger

Bonus versus (any)
Weapon skill dagger
Size one-handed

When wielded

When invoked

(none)

Base price 300 zm
Weight 10
Material iron

Grimtooth is an artifact weapon that appears in NetHack. It is chaotic-aligned, and its base item is an orcish dagger.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
    • 3.1 Average damage calculation
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 UnNetHack
    • 4.3 dNetHack
    • 4.4 xNetHack
    • 4.5 EvilHack
  • 5 References

Generation

Any randomly generated orcish dagger has a base 1⁄20 chance of being made into Grimtooth, as it is the only artifact orcish dagger. Grimtooth may also be given as a sacrifice gift to chaotic, non-elven characters.

Player monster rogues on the Astral Plane have a 25% chance of starting with an orcish dagger in place of their initial primary weapon—like all player monsters on the Plane, there is a 50% chance it will be made into an artifact weapon of the same base item.[1] Grimtooth is the only artifact orcish dagger, resulting in a 12.5% chance that a Rogue will be carrying it on the Planes.

Description

Grimtooth has +d2 to hit and a +d6 damage against all monsters, and while wielded it confers warning against elves, glowing red when any elves are present on the level.[2] Characters that are elven, including those polymorphed into elven monsters, cannot wield Grimtooth and will be blasted if they attempt to.

Strategy

Grimtooth's weak base item means that even with its damage bonuses to all monsters, it is effectively on par with a normal long sword - most chaotic non-elven players will only consider Grimtooth as an obstacle to receiving Stormbringer through sacrifice. However, it averages the same damage as a crysknife, without the crysknife's danger of reverting to a worm tooth or the requirement of a scroll of enchant weapon to create.

Despite its relatively low damage in comparison to other artifacts, orcish Rangers and Rogues that obtain it early are likely to make good use of it until they acquire Stormbringer, Fire Brand or Frost Brand.

Average damage calculation

The average damage calculations in the following table do not include bonuses from weapon skills, strength, or from using a blessed weapon against undead or demons.

Weapon Damage
+0 Grimtooth
+7 Grimtooth

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, Grimtooth gives a flat +6 damage bonus as opposed to 1d6, but is still outshined by the many better artifacts present, particularly for chaotic players. It might be a decent choice for twoweaponing, which is allowed for artifacts in SLASH'EM.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, Grimtooth is permanently poisoned and deals +d6 damage against non-poison resistant monsters, with a 10% chance of killing them instantly - this makes it markedly more useful. Grimtooth is also the first sacrifice gift for Rogues.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, Grimtooth has +d5 to-hit, doubled damage, and warning against elves, humans and minions. It can be created by naming an orcish dagger, and can be twoweaponed as a secondary weapon.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, Grimtooth is permanently poisoned as in UnNetHack, though the removal of poison instadeath makes it somewhat less powerful. Its base price is raised from 300 to 1000.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, Grimtooth has a disease-incuding attack with a 1⁄6 chance of inflicting terminal sickness on the target. Grimtooth also deals extra damage to elves in addition to bonus damage from iron, and has a chance of instakilling any elf it hits (including an elven or drow player).

The sickness inflicted by the disease attack can be used to dispose of targets with massive defenses, such as high level low-AC player monsters, that do not have an immunity or a means of curing it. You are credited (or blamed) for monsters that die of terminal illness this way and gain experience as normal.

References

  1. ↑ src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 270
  2. ↑ src/artilist.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 709: damage bonus against all monsters is special cased in spec_dbon()

Grimtooth may also be given as a [[sacrifice gift]] to chaotic, non-[[Elf (starting race)|elven]] characters. However, it averages the same damage as a [[crysknife]], without the crysknife's danger of reverting to a [[worm tooth]] or the requirement of a [[scroll of enchant weapon]] to create. Despite its relatively low damage in comparison to other artifacts, orcish [[Ranger]]s and Rogues that obtain it early are likely to make good use of it until they acquire Stormbringer, [[Fire Brand]] or [[Frost Brand]]. ===Average damage calculation=== The average damage calculations in the following table do not include bonuses from [[Skill|weapon skills]], [[strength]], or from using a [[blessed]] weapon against [[undead]] or [[M2_DEMON|demons]]. {|class="wikitable" !Weapon !Damage |- | +0 Grimtooth |\frac{1+3}{2}+\frac{1+6}{2}=\bold{5.5} |- | +7 Grimtooth |\frac{1+3}{2}+\frac{1+6}{2}+7=\bold{12.5} |} ==Variants== ===SLASH'EM=== In [[SLASH'EM]], Grimtooth gives a flat +6 damage bonus as opposed to 1d6, but is still outshined by the many better artifacts present, particularly for chaotic players. It might be a decent choice for twoweaponing, which is allowed for artifacts in SLASH'EM. ===UnNetHack=== In [[UnNetHack]], Grimtooth is permanently [[poison]]ed and deals +d6 damage against non-[[Poison resistance|poison resistant]] monsters, with a 10% chance of killing them instantly - this makes it markedly more useful. Grimtooth is also the first sacrifice gift for [[Rogue]]s. ===dNetHack=== In [[dNetHack]], Grimtooth has +d5 to-hit, doubled damage, and warning against elves, [[human (monster attribute)|humans]] and [[minion]]s. It can be created by naming an orcish dagger, and can be [[twoweapon]]ed as a secondary weapon. ===xNetHack=== In [[xNetHack]], Grimtooth is permanently poisoned as in UnNetHack, though the removal of poison instadeath makes it somewhat less powerful. Its base price is raised from 300 to 1000. ===EvilHack=== In [[EvilHack]], Grimtooth has a disease-incuding attack with a {{frac|6}} chance of inflicting terminal [[sickness]] on the target. Grimtooth also deals extra damage to elves in addition to bonus damage from [[iron]], and has a chance of instakilling any elf it hits (including an elven or drow player). The sickness inflicted by the disease attack can be used to dispose of targets with massive defenses, such as high level low-AC [[player monster]]s, that do not have an immunity or a means of curing it. You are credited (or blamed) for monsters that die of terminal illness this way and gain experience as normal. ==References== {{nethack-367}} [[Category:Artifact weapons]]
